intro: Lapsana takasei, commonly known as Japanese yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lapsana takasei is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and ease of care.
